metadata.title: Medu Vada - Easy Tips to Make Crispy Medu Vada - Gluten Free Indian Snack - Thasneen.com
metadata.description:
Medu Vada- Uzhunnu Vada or Urad Dal (Black Gram) Fritters is one of the most popular South Indian fried snacks. In this video, I share the tips for making the perfect light and crispy medu vada. Follow the recipe and you will make the perfect medu vadas. This is a gluten free snack.
Recipe on the blog: https://bit.ly/339FLVA
Urad dal or Skinned Black gram – 1 cup
Shallots or Small onions, chopped small- 1/4 cup
Ginger, minced- 1 tsp
Curry Leaves, chopped- 1 sprig
Whole peppercorns- 1/2 tsp
Green chilies, chopped - 2
Salt- 1 tsp
Water- 1/4 to 1/2 cup to make a smooth & thick batter
Oil- enough for frying

Other Fritter Recipes on my blog: https://bit.ly/33r01SJ
Indian Recipes on my blog: https://bit.ly/2obr9G3
My Cookbook Raving Recipes: https://amzn.to/2ms69Kz

transcription: [00:00.000] Welcome to making crispy Medu Vada, a popular gluten free South Indian snack.
[00:15.000] Take 1 cup urad dal and wash thoroughly under running water.
[00:30.000] Soak the urad dal in water for at least 3–4 hours.
[00:45.000] After soaking, drain all water from the dal.
[01:00.000] Add soaked urad dal into a blender jar without adding extra water.
[01:15.000] Grind to a smooth and fluffy batter.
[01:30.000] Transfer batter to a bowl, add finely chopped shallots and minced ginger.
[01:45.000] Chop curry leaves and add to the batter.
[02:00.000] Add whole peppercorns and finely chopped green chilies.
[02:15.000] Add salt to taste and combine all ingredients well.
[02:30.000] Gradually sprinkle a little water to adjust batter consistency; it should be thick and airy.
[02:45.000] Heat oil in a deep pan over medium flame for frying.
[03:00.000] Wet your hands, take a small portion of batter and shape into a vada.
[03:15.000] Create a hole in the center of the vada for even frying.
[03:30.000] Carefully slide the shaped vada into hot oil.
[03:45.000] Fry on medium heat until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
[04:00.000] Remove the fried vada and drain on kitchen paper towel.
[04:15.000] Fry the remaining batter in batches the same way.
[04:30.000] Ensure oil remains hot but not smoking for perfect crispiness.
[04:45.000] Once all vadas are fried, plate them together.
[05:00.000] Serve hot medu vada with coconut chutney or sambar.
[05:15.000] Enjoy light, fluffy, and crispy Medu Vadas!
[05:30.000] Tips: Soak dal longer for airier batter.
[05:45.000] Use medium oil heat; too hot will brown outside quickly.
[06:00.000] You can use a piping bag to shape vada faster.
[06:15.000] Leftover vadas can be stored and reheated.
[06:30.000] Medu vada pairs well with filter coffee or chutney.
[06:45.000] This recipe is gluten free and perfect for snacks.
[07:00.000] Thanks for watching and happy cooking!
[07:15.000] Don’t forget to subscribe for more South Indian recipes.
[07:30.000] Visit the blog for full written recipe and tips.
[07:45.000] Leave a comment if you try this recipe.

[08:15.000] See you in the next video!
[08:30.000] Goodbye and take care.
[08:45.000] End of Medu Vada recipe demonstration.
